intro.name: Martin Murin, PhD
intro.profession: Data Scientist and Researcher in Particle Physics at CERN
intro.summary: I am a doctoral researcher in data science applied to particle physics. I bring a distinctive skill set at the intersection of data science with machine learning, advanced statistics with scientific reasoning and strong mathematical problem-solving abiliities. I have practical experience in applying machine learning techniques to large datasets and leveraging high-performance computing resources. Passionate about immersing myself in the latest computing technologies, such as artificial intelligence, quantum computing, and blockchain.

projects.title: Measurement of four top quark production cross-section
projects.description: A measurement of the four top quark production rate with the ATLAS experiment at CERN's Large Hadron Collider. This measurement features a sophisticated signal extraction method to handle the large irreducible background. My contribution to this analysis involved the development of a strategy to mitigate the mis-modelling of the large background component.

projects.title: Sensitivity to the CP property of top-Higgs coupling
projects.description: In this project, I investigated the sensitivity of the four top process to the CP property of the top-Higgs coupling. Measurement of this property is a critical test of the Standard Model of particle physics. I developed and optimised a boosted decision tree (BDT) classifier to extract the CP information from the kinematics of the four top process.

projects.title: Calibration of ML-based object identification algorithms
projects.description: Identification of decays of top quark and W and Z bosons is performed by machine learning algorithms. These algorithms are trained on simulated data and require calibration to match the performance on real data. I updated and maintained the framework for calculating the calibration factors for novel identification algorithms.

projects.title: Galactic cluster substructure
projects.description: In this work, I assessed the possibility of using kinematic Sunyaev-Zeldovich effect to detect galaxy cluster substructure by searching for fluctuations on images of kSZ maps of simulated galaxy clusters.

categories.title: Astronomy
categories.description: I am passionate about astronomy and cosmology for its aesthetics and philosophy. I led numerous outreach activities, including public stargazings, astronomy society at my university, and gave engaging talks at elementary schools.

categories.title: Adventure
categories.description: I love exploring new places, cultures, and cuisines. Most recently, I travelled solo through southeast Asia and India, immersing myself in the historical narratives. I gained profound insights into the diverse societal structures, observed stark economic disparities between regions, and discovered their varying life philosophies.

categories.title: Activities
categories.description: I maintain a healthy lifestyle through regular weightlifting workouts and swimming sessions. Spending time outdoor is a great way to unwind and recharge for me. I enjoy hiking, cycling, and snowboarding.
